answers.answer: Honey im in the same boat im 27 wks sunday and my Dr told me the same thing and has me really insecure and depressed on my weight. .I've already gained 40lbs ...I can't go walking because I have nerve damage in my right knee and have 2 disk out in my lumbar/lower back. .so its really painful to walk and my knee swells up really bad ...so my oulther Dr told me to just watch what I eat and drink a lotof water...if u have a pool or know someone that does swimming is the best thing u can do..Keep ur head up love its only temporary. ..and its all for a good reason. .
Ty for the kind words!! They help. Good luck to you and congratulations!!

I'm sorry. I've also gained about 26 lbs but my midwife isn't upset because I can't walk or anything to counter my weight she just asked me to be more conscience about the foods I eat. I feel bad about how much I gained and it is depressing to me but I don't know what to do.

I am going through the same thing. I'm 30 wks and the nurse and midwife are giving me crap about my weight. I've gained 33lbs total. They even just assumed all I'm eating is junk food and I haven't touched junk food since I found out I was pregnant. My Dr on the other hand tells me that I'm fine and that we are just having a big baby. The midwife even assumed I had gestational diabetes. What a B****!! My Dr said not to listen to them anymore.. and if she was concerned she would tell me herself. As long as my baby is healthy I really don't care about a few more pounds. It will all come off in the end!! Don't be insecure about anything. This is supposed to be a beautiful experience, so don't let anyone take that away from you!! Eat healthy and exercise if you can and go from there. I wish you all the best!! Good luck!!
